Thinking that you might be able to trap him, you quickly dash down the forested side of the road and have him surrounded by you and Kate as well as the D-building wall and the forest, meaning that his only way out would be to head for the forest.

The dark haired man gives you a surprised look as you hurry past him and raises an eyebrow when you halt and turn to face him again, but then he realizes what you are up to.

“Oh, you thought I’d run from you?” He chuckles. “If I would have wanted to do that, I would have done so before you even took notice of me. It seemed to take your friend long enough to finish that girl, so I had plenty of time to do that.”

“So why didn’t you?” Kate sound skeptical, but then again he sounded fairly sure of himself.

“Oh, I thought I’d be able to give you some pointers and since you took my snack I figured I might as well enjoy the show if I now didn’t get to enjoy the taste.” He chuckled again “Judging by how things looked I’d say you didn’t get to enjoy her taste either.”

Kate somehow seemed more at ease now, as far as you could tell he wasn’t about to rat you out so maybe he was alright.

“Hmm, I kind of regret that you know, but I was so damn hungry. To be honest I wouldn’t mind a bit more to eat and I’m pretty sure I could enjoy it properly this time.”

“Hah, no doubt. You looked like you had starved yourself.”

“Well you seem to have taken the loss of a meal with ease. You wouldn’t mind telling us where one could find more and not risk detection?”

“Oh, sure. I’d say right here is a good place, two yummy girls, one even has filling.”

Kate manages an unsteady giggle. “Not that funny, I hope your normal jokes are better than that.”

“Joke? Oh alright. It might not be my strong point, as for your question I wasn’t really looking for a meal, just a snack for fun, I’ll hopefully be getting my fill later tonight.”

“Oh? Any chance me and Mary could get a thing or two to eat then too?”

“Hmm…I see no harm in that, but you seemed pretty hungry, I doubt you could hold until late tonight could you?” The guy said before turning to you. “Are you hungry too? Mary was it?”

“Not really, though I doubt I could hold until tonight, if that was what you were asking. And yes I’m Mary and my greedy-gut friend is Kate, and you are?”

“Chris.” He answered and the smile of his face grew ever wider as he heard Kate’s muttering of not being the greedy-gut.

“Oh not greedy is it?” Chris laughed as he faced Kate again. “You just fed it a whole girl and said yourself that you wanted more, that would be counted for as greedy by most, though don’t fret, most voreaphiles are greedy-guts.”

“Vorea-what?”

“Ah, you don’t know?!” Chris sighed and tried to face the both of you with moderate success. “You see the act of swallowing another person whole is called vore, so someone interested in it would be a voreaphile…hmm never really occurred to me but I guess a willing meal would also be that although I guess they wouldn’t last long, either way I haven’t met one or ever heard of one…” He stopped himself. “So you see you are voreaphiles like me and all voreaphiles I’ve met are greedy-guts so don’t take the word to harshly.”

Waiting a second or so to see if the information got through to you he then continued. “So how was it, would you like something in that gut of yours now?”

You wake, unsure where, or who you are. You are somewhere dark, warm, and wet, yet comfortable, completely enveloping you. A heartbeat, not your own, fills your ears, promising safety. It feels like your mother's womb. Strangely, at the thought of mother, two faces come to you. One, red haired, green eyed, somewhat elven looking, on a tall, voluptuous frame. The other, Asian, brown eyes, black hair, on a short, pixie like body. You know one is your own mother, and the other your best friends mother, but can't tell which is which. You try to remember how you got here, and a cascade of images and sensations flood you.

You realize that you really are in a womb. Your body feels strange and familiar at the same time. Sliding a hand down your front, you feel a C-cup, not a D. You also feel a warm presence in your stomach. No, not your stomach. Your womb. Kate. Kate is in your womb. But you are Kate. No, you are in Kate's body. You are Mary, and you are in your mother's womb.

“Everything Okay in there?” The voice is yours, or Mary's, so maybe you really are Kate. “Sweet Brigid! I really sound like you! Hold on, let me get you out.” Okay, maybe you are Mary. Things finally fall into some kind of order, and you can make sense of what happened. As you struggle to get your mind around what happened, your surroundings shift and press against you. Hard. At the top of your head, something gives way. You slide into your mother's birth canal, smelling and tasting her juices. With a plop, your head encounters fresh, cool air as you are literally born again. The rest of you soon follows. You lie, gasping, a until warm water splashes on you.

“Wakey, wakey, love.” Strange to hear your voice with that accent. “Let's get cleaned up. I'm all sweaty, and you're all sticky. You open your eyes, finding yourself in your mother's shower. You always envied her bathroom. In addition to her bedroom being the size of the living room, she had her own bathroom, as big a Susan's room. It has a shower you could lie down in, as you are doing now. It also had it's own jacuzzi, and a full vanity next to the sink.

You are pulled to your feet, and pushed under the shower head. She starts rubbing you down with a soapy cloth, taking liberties with her hands. You are disappointed when she pushes you down to your knees so she she can shampoo your hair. You are facing her as she does this, at just the right height for a little muff diving. As the water rinses you clean, you go to work, nearly causing her to fall as she cums.

For the first time, you take a good look at your mother. She does look just like you, at least how you looked before your kid sister made you her breakfast. It's strange to look up at her. You're used to being taller than other women, and many men. Kate is five one, at most. You, as Mary, already had your mother's height, five ten, although you didn't quite have her full figure. Mom used to have at least twenty or thirty pounds on you, although it was in all the right places. She wasn't zaftig plump, but that was because of her height.

You grab the soap and washcloth, and start cleaning her, taking extra time in her sensitive spots. Once that is done, you push her down so you can shampoo her hair. As she rinsed off, she leans forward to return the favor. You notice she has to fully sit down to be level with your clam. Being short will take some getting used to. After just a few minutes of her skilled, and very, very, experience tongue, you shatter, falling against the shower wall and sliding down across from her.

“Ahh, nothing like a hot shower after a good fuck, or unbirthing,” Mom says. “Mike must've brought us up to my room when we passed out. I didn't want to get my bed or carpet all messy, so I came in here. We must've slept four or five hours.” It's weird hearing her talk with your voice. She usually sounds more American, but when she's angry, tired, or excited, some of her old lilt slips in. You used to think it was odd, since she was supposed to be born here. Shows how little you know.

“Just one problem,” you say. At her puzzled look, you grab a lock of her long hair, holding it up so she can see it was red, not blond.

“Not to worry,” she says. “Any hair I grow now will be blond. Watch and learn.” As you look on, her hair starts to lengthen before your eyes, blond at the roots. It reaches past her delicious ass (and you always thought your ass was fat) almost to her knees. There was a mix of blond and red at about her waist. Since your hair hadn't gone much lower than your shoulders, she had plenty to work with.

“Got scissors?” you ask. She gets up, walks over to the vanity, and rummages in the drawers, triumphantly brandishing a sharp pair. “Perfect. Now sit down, and let me fix this.” You practically force her down on the chair. Snatching a fine comb, you spend a few minutes getting her hair straight and tangle free. Then you get to work. You always loved cutting hair. First, you cut off the excess at about the middle of her back. You comb the hair straight back. She always hated bangs. Thought they made her look childish. A pony tail, or over one eye, that was her style. You think you might make your part time job at the salon a career. It also let you chat with all kinds of people and gossip.

“There, done,” you say.

“Great job! I never knew you could do that.”

“What are you talking about, Mary, I always cut your hair.”

“Mary? You're Mary.”

“No, I'm...” And then it hits you. Kate has a job at the salon, and likes meeting people. You have a job bartending, and like watching people make idiots of themselves. Mike is the bouncer, and got you the job. You have two sets of memories, two personalities. You and Kate are polar opposites, like most best friends.

Kate is outgoing, almost bubbly, getting along with almost anyone, and more than a bit naive. You found her far too trusting. She always had a habit of not thinking about the consequences. Time after time, she got you and Mike in trouble along with her. Just jump in, don't bother checking if there's water in the pool. Dad or Mike will catch me anyway. She is an only child. Her father is a brutal looking cop who terrifies most of the neighborhood kids, but is a teddy bear with her. Her mother is the tough one, but she is a complete pushover compared to your mom, just grounding her or taking away her phone privileges.

Your mother can make thugs suddenly remember things they need to do. In the next town. Or the next state. Just by calmly looking at them, not snarling or screaming. Kate's dad says he wishes he was half as intimidating as her. You remember your father being a very nice guy, who never raised hand, or even voice, to you. Mom handled all the discipline.

Where Kate got Snow White, you got the Cattle Raid of Cooley. No Dr. Seuss for you. Actually, you kind of prefer it that way. All those stories with no happy ending did a far better job preparing you for the real world. As Mom loved pointing out, those knights' shining armor was usually crimson by the end of the day, and sometimes feeding the dragon was better than what the knight had in mind. After all, all the dragon could do was kill you. Who knows what evil lurks in the heart of men?

While outwardly friendly, you always hold back until someone prove themselves. Kate squeals whenever she sees a baby, kitten, or puppy. You think, glad it's not puking on me, can it catch mice, and can it guard the house, respectively. She also tends to panic when things get crazy, usually with you calmly dragging her to the nearest exit, elbow in the face of some drunk frat boy, knee in the crotch of another.

It's actually a fair deal between you. She gets protection from the evils of the real world, and you get a conduit to a brighter and more carefree world, and someone who can help you interact with other people, instead of shutting everyone out. If it wasn't for Kate, you would be the moody goth chick everyone stayed away from. Your mother once said she didn't care if you were happy so long as you were alive. You kept her alive, but Kate made life worth living for the two of you.

No, the three of you. Mike, sweet Mike. Many say that you and Mike were male and female versions of each other, and almost as many mistake you as twins. In looks and temperment, you mirrored each other. Kate kept Mike from being the total sociopath the guidance counselors feared. Like you, he wasn't much of a turn the other cheek kind of guy. More of a crush your enemies, drive them before you, and hear the lamenting of their women. Kate had her sitcoms and romantic comedies, you and Mike had the Governator. But Kate always cheered him up, enough so that he just hurt bullies and the guys who wouldn't take 'no' for an answer, instead of maiming them.
